channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hundreds of Flights Canceled at New York Airports, Even With a Few Inches of Snow
item.description: To avoid the ripple effects of real-time adjustments to what was predicted to be up to nine inches of snow, the major airlines said they pre-emptively...

item.title: How Oil, Drugs and Immigration Fueled Trump’s Venezuela Campaign
item.description: New details of deliberations show how aides with overlapping agendas drove the United States toward a militarized confrontation with Venezuela.

item.title: Russia Pummels Kyiv Before Trump-Zelensky Meeting
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that the assault with hundreds of drones and missiles, lasting nearly 10 hours, showed that Moscow was no...

item.title: Kennedy Center seeks $1 million in damages from musician who canceled performance after Trump name added to building
item.description: The law explicitly prohibits the board of trustees from making the center into a memorial to anyone else, and from putting another person’s name on th...

item.title: Peter Thiel and Larry Page are preparing to flee California in case the state passes a billionaire wealth tax, report says
item.description: The proposal calls for California residents worth more than $1 billion to pay a one-time tax equivalent to 5% of their assets.

item.title: New York Receives Its Heaviest Snowfall in Nearly 4 Years, Disrupting Flights
item.description: Central Park got more than four inches of snow for the first time since January 2022, with higher totals outside New York City.

item.title: Cisco’s top exec and Amazon’s Andy Jassy share the same hiring red flag—and it’s something that can’t be taught
item.description: It’s not what you know, or even who you know. According to Cisco’s new U.K. chief, your next promotion might hinge on your attitude.

item.title: After U.S. debt soared to $38 trillion, the ‘easy times’ are now over as hedge funds jump into the bond market, former Treasury official warns
item.description: Hedge funds have doubled their presence in the Treasury market in the last four years.

item.title: Scott Galloway says the key to landing jobs is be as social as possible: ‘70% of the time, the person they pick is someone with an internal advocate’
item.description: “You want to be placed in rooms of opportunities where you’re not physically there,” the NYU Stern School of Business professor said.

item.title: A Second Lawsuit Accuses Tyler Perry of Sexual Assault
item.description: Mario Rodriguez, who had a role in one of Mr. Perry’s films, sued him on Thursday, months after another actor filed a similar lawsuit.

item.title: Russia Pummels Kyiv Before Trump-Zelensky Meeting
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said that the assault with hundreds of drones and missiles, lasting nearly 10 hours, showed that Moscow was no...

item.title: In Myanmar, the Election Is Called Fake, but the Human Suffering Is Real
item.description: A coup set off a brutal civil war and made a poor country poorer. Now its military rulers are seeking a veneer of legitimacy by holding elections.

item.title: How Oil, Drugs and Immigration Fueled Trump’s Venezuela Campaign
item.description: New details of deliberations show how aides with overlapping agendas drove the United States toward a militarized confrontation with Venezuela.

item.title: Map: 6.6-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Near Taiwan
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia Reach Cease-Fire in Brutal Border War
item.description: The 72-hour cease-fire could pave the way for an end to the fighting, which has killed dozens and displaced thousands over nearly three weeks.
